commitResults.messageTitle: Resovle the Compatibility Issue Between Level-7 and Level-8
Modified the Code to be more OOP, reaching the minmal requirement
Modified the structure of the code, achieved the stretch level of OOP, changed names to fit the suggested standard and removed obsolete Commands.
Added Gradle Wrapper to the Project, achieving the second level of being about to execute unit test.
Added the Jar Featurea and Fixed some issue with build.gradle
Add JavaDoc comments to the code, acheving the stretch level.
Added Gradle Checkstyle feature and config file. Fixed the coding standard issues.
Resolved conflicts when merging the branches. Fixed Styling issue and added more JavaDoc
Added Search Feature, allowing user to search deadline and event happened on a given date. (Achieving Streach Goal of Level 8)
Added GUI to the App, changed the name of the project from Duke to Mr. Bear. Updated readMe.md
Allowed to find multiple keyword at the same time using Vararg
Release the v2.0 version of the ChatBot.
Improve Code Quality by break down long methods. Fixed the bug of not reading eventTask correctly.

commitResults.messageBody:
The previous version of Mr. Bear Does not have any checking mechanisms
to verify the format of the event stored in the storage file as I
assumed that events would be written to the file in the correct format.
However, this cannot be guaranteed and should any event be stored in
the wrong format and loaded incorrectly, the whole program would
potentially crash. Therefore, it is the necessary to add an
assertion feature to verify the assumption is indeed true.

Add assertion to check whether the event type are of the format [T],
[D], [E], representing TodoTask, DeadlineTask, and EventTask
respectively. Add assertion to check whether the isDone status is of
the format [ ], or [X]. If not, terminate the program and display the
relevant error message.

The current version of Mr. Bear does not have an in-app help menu that allows user to check the format of the their command. Although it does have error prompt to notify the user when the input invalid command, it is still rather inconvenient.

Therefore, I added an help command to allow the user to check all the available command and their respective functionalities by displaying it in a dialog box.

In order to update the description of a task in the current version of Mr. Bear, the user has no choice but to delete the task first and added a new one with the intended description, which is very tedious.

Therefore, a direct update function is added to allow the users to alter the description easily and the help menu is also changed.

Added Reminder feature with the help of Java Stream to display all the deadline events in sorted by their respective deadline.
Added MassDelete feature that allows user to delete all the tasks that have been done in one go.
Modified the constant names to follow the coding standard.
Improve the overall code quality, make the code more readable. Added more javaDoc when missing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve Code Quality for all Command Classes
Modified the Original Search Feature to View Schedule Feature

commitResults.messageBody: This allows user to find a free date in the next month.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve Code Quality for Multiple Classes

commitResults.messageBody: Add inline comments to all the method and fields to make it easier to understand.

commitResults.messageTitle: Allows the Task time to be more Specific
commitResults.messageBody: The current version of Mr. Bear only supports time as specific as a single date. I updated to allow it to be able to be specific to the minute and also updated the help information.
